properties.Name: BenefitCriteria
properties.Description:
Benefit market segmentation is a strategy for defining consumers by the benefits they seek from a product or service.    

For example, benefits for a product may include price, flavor, health, investment objectives.

The business organization identifies a finite number of Benefit Criteria that are used to identify individuals and prospective individuals.   These criteria will be unique to each business organization and focus upon that organization's specific information requirements.

The Benefit Criteria is the specific variable or value that may be linked to a Market Segment.

The Benefit Type is the larger category to which the Benefit Criteria belongs.

Benefit Criteria Type is a means of classifying, grouping or categorizing specific Benefit Criteria at a higher level for analysis and presentation.

The Benefit Criteria is the specific variable or value that may be linked to a Market Segment.

The Benefit Type is the larger category to which the Benefit Criteria belongs.

The following are examples:

Benefit Criteria:  Long Term Appreciation
Benefit Criteria Type:  Investment Objective

Benefit Criteria:  Retirement Savings
Benefit Criteria Type:  Investment Objective

Columns.Name: BenefitCriteriaId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Benefit Criteria.

Columns.Name: BenefitCriteriaName
Columns.Description: The name of the Benefit Criteria.

Columns.Name: BenefitCriteriaDescription
Columns.Description: The description of the Benefit Criteria.

Columns.Name: BenefitCriteriaTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Benefit Criteria Type.
